subject: Business
title: Leading Organizational Change
description: A micro-lesson that makes Leading Organizational Change usable.

hook.text: 70% of organizational change initiatives fail. The reason isn't bad strategy â€” it's bad leadership through the change.

buildup.text: Kotter's 8-step model starts with creating urgency and building a guiding coalition before any change begins.

discovery.text: People resist change not because they're stubborn, but because they fear loss: status, comfort, competence.

twist.text: Most leaders announce change and expect compliance. Real change requires emotional buy-in, not just rational agreement.

climax.text: Quick wins are essential: small visible successes build momentum and prove the change is working.

punchline.text: People don't resist change. They resist being changed.

quiz.question: Why do 70% of organizational change initiatives fail?
options: Leaders fail to build emotional buy-in and manage people through the transition
The strategies behind the changes are always wrong
Employees are naturally resistant to any change
